title: ICE with mismatch in trait associated constant

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code

```rust
#![feature(associated_const_equality)]
#![allow(dead_code)]

trait TraitWAssocConst {
    const A: usize;
}

fn foo<T: TraitWAssocConst<A = 1>>() {}

fn bar<T: TraitWAssocConst<A = 0>>() {
    foo::<T>();
}

fn main() {}
```

### Error output

thread `<unnamed>` panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', [compiler/rustc_trait_selection/src/traits/project.rs:562](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/bdb07a8ec8e77aa10fb84fae1d4ff71c21180bb4/compiler/rustc_trait_selection/src/traits/project.rs#L562)

### Regression

Regression in nightly-2022-12-04, in rollup 24f2704e96c9d3a4f887d2d0a7d79ecffd79bd65, likely from #104903 (@spastorino, @lcnr)
